name: Hyatt Place Atlanta Airport

reviews.text: I booked this hotel about 4 months in advance. For that reason I got a good deal. I do not feel like I over paid. The hotel is pretty dated as far as the elevators, hallways, pool and fitness center are concerned. The room was decent and very large, space was the highlight of the room. The beds were a little hard but decent. The remote to the tv didnt have a back on it. I called down for housekeeping and was transferred to a voicemail. No one ever returned my call, had to call again a few hours later and the agent at the desk assited me. It was a lot of little things that affected my stay at this hotel. On the other hand the breakfast was good to be complimentary, had a variety to choose from and the staff was nice as well. The dining area was pretty small for the amount of people that were down there. It was easier to take the breakfast to the room. I didnt like the location either. I was there on business, but everything was so far away as far as activities are concerned. This area is definately not a prime location. I probably will not stay here again, but for what it was it was okay.
reviews.title: okay

reviews.text: We got stuck on a layover and just needed a close reasonable place for 1 nt. Very friendly staff but a little older property. Needs an update. The smell of air freshener in the lobby was so overpowering, it closed my sinuses up. It was better the next day after I complained about it. Hyatt Places now offer a small menu of sandwiches, soup or salads. They were right next to a Ruby Tuesday and American Brasserie also. I would probably try something else next time.
reviews.title: Convenient and just okay

reviews.text: We stayed here after landing at Atlanta airport one evening. It's literally just around the corner from where we picked our hire car up, so good location if that's what you intend to do. We were not disappointed- really friendly staff checked us in and the rooms were clean and modern. There was a small bar where we could purchase bottled beers. Breakfast was good, with plenty of seating. Recommended!
reviews.title: Clean, tidy and modern- Perfect stop-off for the airport

reviews.text: I stayed here during my business trip for one night. I like the area since its close to my client, its a clean place and the staff is very nice. They upgraded their breakfast offerings, they have good breakfast sandwiches and fresh eggs. I also used the gym, that was nicely equipped with lifefitness equipment. I recommend this location and will continue to use them.
reviews.title: Good spot near the airport

reviews.text: I stayed here due to layover at ATL. The room was very nice and comfortable. The front desk employee was just there, no sense of urgentancy or compasion. The room itself was nice and I just showered and passed out so I could not comment on much else.
reviews.title: Nice layover

reviews.text: We stayed one night for a layover to Costa RIca. Plenty of space for a family of four and free breakfast before our flight. Couldn't of asked for anything more. Ten minute drive from airport in comp. shuttle.
reviews.title: Wasn't bad

reviews.text: nice hotel but look out! stayed here 2 nights for a soccer tournament and... my car was broken into the first night in the only area of the parking lot where the cameras were not working?? sounded suspicious to me. the next night another players car was stolen from another part of the parking lot and lo and behold the camera for that area was not working that night. I would not recommend anyone stay here. the police said this happens all the time in this area and did not seem to concerned about stopping it. That weekend there were several cars broken into in the same area as well.
reviews.title: beware

reviews.text: This was an unknown property at the Atlanta Airport until I found it online when reserving a one night stay using my Hyatt points. There is another Hyatt Place property on the other side of the airport in which I have previously stayed but, to be honest, I found it to be "tired and worn". Not so this property. Everything appeared to be fresh and new. The outside was as immaculate as the interior and rooms. Wireless internet worked without an issue and my check-in was flawless. The only downsides to this property are (1) storage closet very sparse and (2) be sure to carry ID if you expect to order a drink. They don't care how old you are, their policy requires you display an ID.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem at Atlanta Harfield Airport

reviews.text: I had a reservation here for 2 nights while attending a nearby event. I left after one night after it was impossible to sleep. A hotel next to the airport should be somewhat soundproof, but you can hear every plane taking off. This is in addition to the A/C unit which sounds like a jet engine itself. The room itself was OK, very spacious but it smelled terrible. I left the first room after it smelled like smoke, and the 2nd room wasn't much better.
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you want to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel agreed to give me my money back, but hotels.com has so far been unsuccessful in reaching anyone at the hotel to get me my money back.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: breakfast here made my day
reviews.title: BREAKFAST MADE MY DAY

reviews.text: it was a little disconcerting to see the maids hangin out at the starbucks bar adjacent to the front desk also eating the guest breakfast
reviews.title: Exercise in Frustration - why I won't go back

reviews.text: im all for rewarding employees with free food....but watching maids eat ( and them me ) was a little.....um freakishly odd....
reviews.title: Very Nice ATL airport hotel alternative

reviews.text: gourmet omelettes with spinach...yummy !!!
reviews.title: Okay, but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms are beautifully appointed. GO ON PRICELINE TO BOOK THIS HOTEL; don't pay their regular rate its a rip off..
reviews.title: Convenient to Airport

reviews.text: Complimentary shuttle from/to the airport. Hotel is less than 10 minutes away from airport. Check-in was fast and friendly. Room was spacious, with comfortable bed, large flat screen TV, free wifi, fridge, bathroom was spotless. A great complimentary breakfast is included, and food is available 24 hours. Hotel is located away from traffic so a quiet night sleep is guaranteed. Check-out was very fast. There is also one large chain restaurant less than a five minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt Place Atlanta Airport after a long trip; it was so good to check in and be greeted with a friendly smile and to be welcomed personally by name. The room was well kept and very clean. Had food at the bar and it was really great; cheddar char burger is a hit! Breakfast the next morning featured hot breakfast sandwiches, cereals, juices, bagels and much more. Easy check in, easy check out. Well worth the money; I will be back again soon! Thank you Hyatt Place team!
reviews.title: Home at the Hyatt Place

reviews.text: Great staff at airport Hyatt just minutes from airport with excellent service.We enjoyed an early breakfast with great coffee.We had dinner at ruby Tuesday's just a few mins away which was very good.Will return very soon.
reviews.title: Short stay before flying to Europe . Terrific service.

reviews.text: I have been traveling to Atlanta for the past 13 years and this was the worst hotel I've ever been too. I am a frequent traveler to Atlanta and also have stayed at the Hyatt North. First customer service was terrible. There were a number of times the frontdesk was empty for 10 to 15 minutes at a time. The ladies at the counter were not presentable hair wise and they were half dressed .Their attitudes were like someone owed them something very unpleasant. Also my debit card was charged 162 dollars. I paid for my room with hotwire in early December . No one was authorized to run the card they did it because no one looked at the notes. My daughters who are ten and six notice the unprofessionalism and the attitudes. My daughters found a huge what looked like an over sized tick climbing out of the lights in between the beds of our room. Also the breakfast was terrible, at the end of breakfast I saw a gentleman who worked there picking up the pancakes with his hands and putting them back in the pan. Those were the same pancakes that were put out the next day. Also I asked to speak to the manager and him or her did not come out twice. The best thing about this hotel were the cleaning ladies. Now I have to deal with the 162 dollars which was charged to my card twice and put me in the negative now im dealing with overdraft fees. I would not let my dogs stay here!
reviews.title: worst hotel ever

reviews.text: My room and the common areas of the hotel were clean. The staff friendly and helpful. I will agree the food is not great. There is a Ruby Tuesdays nearby, but that's the only option. The convenience to the airport is perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect for short stays

aka: Hyatt Place Atlanta Airport Hotel College Park
